# Sea Lion Operator‚Äôs Update

Rockhopper Exploration plc

25 November 2024

The information contained within this Announcement is deemed by Rockhopper Exploration plc to constitute inside information as stipulated under the Market Abuse Regulation (EU) No. 596/2014 as it forms part of UK law by virtue of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018 ("MAR").

25 November 2024

Rockhopper Exploration plc

("Rockhopper" or the "Company")

Sea Lion Operator's Update

Rockhopper Exploration plc (AIM: RKH), the oil and gas company with key interests in the North Falkland Basin ("NFB"), notes the recent update published by Navitas Petroleum LP ("Navitas" or the "Operator") on Sea Lion development progress which includes an updated NFB independent resource report conducted by Netherland Sewell & Associates ("NSAI") (the "October 2024 NSAI Independent Report") on behalf of Navitas.

The EIS for the Northern Development Area, Phase 1 & 2 development (the "Northern Development Area") was submitted to the Falkland Islands Government ("FIG") for statutory public consultation in July 2024 and in November FIG confirmed that, having received a number of comments, no further public consultation was required. An MOU has been signed for the provision of a redeployed FPSO with a current UK safety case. FEED for the FPSO commenced in November 2024.

The hydrocarbons will initially be produced through the redeployed FPSO with a peak production rate of up to 55,000 bbls/d.

Published¬†May 05, 2025, 05:00 AM

Updated¬†May 05, 2025, 09:22 AM

SINGAPORE ‚Äì Singapore‚Äôs home-grown large language model (LLM), Sea-Lion, is steadily gaining traction, with some 235,000¬†downloads so far, bolstered by adoption by large companies such as GoTo Group in Indonesia.

After releasing the latest model with ‚Äúreasoning‚Äù capabilities on April 15, its researchers at AI Singapore told The Straits Times that they plan to add voice recognition later in 2025, followed by other modalities such as visual recognition.

The new features are expected to enhance the model‚Äôs usability in a region rich in spoken and unwritten languages. The model currently recognises 13 languages, including Javanese, Sudanese, Malay, Tamil, Thai and Vietnamese, as well as English and Chinese.

Sea-Lion is already tapped by some businesses for its language features, with GoTo among the first enterprises to adopt Sea-Lion in February 2024 as a base to build its own artificial intelligence (AI) system.

Its chief data officer, Mr Ofir Shalev, noted: ‚ÄúTraining a model from scratch is often prohibitively expensive. So like many in the industry, we adopted a continuous pre-training approach ‚Äì building on an existing model as the starting point.‚Äù

GoTo‚Äôs Sahabat-AI model is now benchmarked as more accurate in reading and interpreting Bahasa Indonesia, Javanese and Sundanese than other models of similar size, according to Mr Shalev.

# Sea Lion Operator‚Äôs Update

Rockhopper Exploration plc

25 November 2024

The information contained within this Announcement is deemed by Rockhopper Exploration plc to constitute inside information as stipulated under the Market Abuse Regulation (EU) No. 596/2014 as it forms part of UK law by virtue of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018 ("MAR").

25 November 2024

Rockhopper Exploration plc

("Rockhopper" or the "Company")

Sea Lion Operator's Update

Rockhopper Exploration plc (AIM: RKH), the oil and gas company with key interests in the North Falkland Basin ("NFB"), notes the recent update published by Navitas Petroleum LP ("Navitas" or the "Operator") on Sea Lion development progress which includes an updated NFB independent resource report conducted by Netherland Sewell & Associates ("NSAI") (the "October 2024 NSAI Independent Report") on behalf of Navitas.

The EIS for the Northern Development Area, Phase 1 & 2 development (the "Northern Development Area") was submitted to the Falkland Islands Government ("FIG") for statutory public consultation in July 2024 and in November FIG confirmed that, having received a number of comments, no further public consultation was required. An MOU has been signed for the provision of a redeployed FPSO with a current UK safety case. FEED for the FPSO commenced in November 2024.

The hydrocarbons will initially be produced through the redeployed FPSO with a peak production rate of up to 55,000 bbls/d.

# S‚Äôpore‚Äôs AI large language model Sea-Lion to offer more features as more firms use it in S-E Asia

[Sign up now:](https://www.straitstimes.com/newsletter-signup) Get ST's newsletters delivered to your inbox

The Sea-Lion team consists of (from left) Miss Hamsawardhini Rengarajan, Dr Ngui Jian Gang, Dr Leslie Teo, Miss Leong Wai Yi, Mr Tai Ngee Chia (seated) and Mr David Ong.

ST PHOTO: HESTER TAN

[Krist Boo](https://www.straitstimes.com/authors/krist-boo?ref=article-byline)

###### Follow topic:

AI/artificial intelligence

Published¬†May 05, 2025, 05:00 AM

Updated¬†May 05, 2025, 09:22 AM

SINGAPORE ‚Äì Singapore‚Äôs home-grown large language model (LLM), Sea-Lion, is steadily gaining traction, with some 235,000¬†downloads so far, bolstered by adoption by large companies such as GoTo Group in Indonesia.

After releasing the latest model with ‚Äúreasoning‚Äù capabilities on April 15, its researchers at AI Singapore told The Straits Times that they plan to add voice recognition later in 2025, followed by other modalities such as visual recognition.

The new features are expected to enhance the model‚Äôs usability in a region rich in spoken and unwritten languages. The model currently recognises 13 languages, including Javanese, Sudanese, Malay, Tamil, Thai and Vietnamese, as well as English and Chinese.

Sea-Lion is already tapped by some businesses for its language features, with GoTo among the first enterprises to adopt Sea-Lion in February 2024 as a base to build its own artificial intelligence (AI) system.

Its chief data officer, Mr Ofir Shalev, noted: ‚ÄúTraining a model from scratch is often prohibitively expensive. So like many in the industry, we adopted a continuous pre-training approach ‚Äì building on an existing model as the starting point.‚Äù

GoTo‚Äôs Sahabat-AI model is now benchmarked as more accurate in reading and interpreting Bahasa Indonesia, Javanese and Sundanese than other models of similar size, according to Mr Shalev.

# SEA-LION

Southeast Asian Languages in One Network

Introducing SEA-LION v4, our most performant multimodal model yet.Open-source, multilingual, and designed to run on your laptop.

[Model Download](https://huggingface.co/collections/aisingapore/sea-lion-v4-68aa7bb8061d497a4f9f2fec)

[APIs](https://playground.sea-lion.ai/key-manager)

[Telegram Bot](https://t.me/sealion_ai_bot)

[Aquarium](https://aquarium.sea-lion.ai/)

## Core Capabilities

### Open & Collaborative

- Fully open-source and community-driven
- Framework-agnostic for research and commercial use

### Excellence

- Benefits from SOTA models & fine-tuned on SEA data
- Purpose-built to understand SEA cultures and contexts

### Resource Efficient

- High performance even on low infrastructure
- Quantized models deployable on lightweight setups, like laptops

### Multimodal

- Supports both image and text inputs (audio soon)
- Enables document comprehension, visual Q&A, and reasoning

### Multilingual

- Performant in over 11 Southeast Asian languages
- Produces culturally aligned and context-aware outputs

### Safe & Secure

- Safety-tuned for SEA contexts
- Aligned with human-curated data for reliable results

### Pan-Southeast Asia AI Developer Challenge

As part of the Pan-SEA AI Developer Challenge that kicked off on 4 August 2025, SEA-LION v4 will join other models to power the final round ‚Äî with 40 teams across the region building innovative applications for Southeast Asia.

[Find out more about the challenge](https://seadeveloperchallenge.ai/)

## Collaborate with us!

We welcome collaboration

      "text": "As Artificial Intelligence (AI) accelerates across Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), Qualcomm Technologies has added a new Large Language Model (LLM) to Qualcomm AI Hub: SEA-LION (Southeast Asian Languages in One Network), developed by AI Singapore. The first LLM focused on Southeast Asia, SEA-LION enables developers to build applications in Southeast Asian languages, optimizing them for on-device deployment on Snapdragon platforms.

### **SEA-LION ‚Äìbuilt for Southeast Asia, by Southeast Asia**

With a diverse population of more than 675 million people and a growing significance on the global stage, ASEAN countries need LLMs that are custom built for the region. SEA-LION is a family of open-source LLMs that better understands Southeast Asia‚Äôs diverse contexts, languages, and cultures.

SEA-LION is an open-source project anchored by the Products Pillar of AI Singapore. AI Singapore‚Äôs work on SEA-LION aims to create LLMs that cater to under-represented population groups and low resource languages in the SEA region. AI Singapore does this by training SEA-LION on native content in Vietnamese, Bahasa Indonesia, Thai, and other Southeast Asian languages.

Available on Qualcomm AI Hub, the SEA-LION v3.5 is based on Meta‚Äôs Llama 3.1 8B. This version has been quantized and pre-optimized for deployment on devices powered by Snapdragon 8 Elite and Snapdragon X Elite, enabling responsive performance without relying on the cloud.

### **Unlocking intelligent applications for Southeast Asia with Qualcomm AI Hub**

Qualcomm AI Hub simplifies the process of deploying AI models on edge devices. By leveraging SEA-LION via the Qualcomm AI Hub, developers get:

- A regionally relevant LLM tuned for Southeast Asian languages and cultural context
- Pre-optimized deployment packages ready to run on Snapdragon hardware
- Documentation and tools that streamline testing and integration

      "text": "# SEA-LION-v1-3B

SEA-LION is a collection of Large Language Models (LLMs) which has been pretrained and instruct-tuned for the Southeast Asia (SEA) region.
The size of the models range from 3 billion to 7 billion parameters.
This is the card for SEA-LION-v1-3B.

SEA-LION stands for _Southeast Asian Languages In One Network_.

## Model Details

### Model Description

The SEA-LION model is a significant leap forward in the field of Natural Language Processing,
specifically trained to understand the SEA regional context.

SEA-LION-v1-3B is built on the robust MPT architecture and has a vocabulary size of 256K.

For tokenization, the model employs our custom SEABPETokenizer, which is specially tailored for SEA languages, ensuring optimal model performance.

The training data for SEA-LION-v1-3B encompasses 980B tokens.

- **Developed by:** Products Pillar, AI Singapore
- **Funded by:** Singapore NRF
- **Model type:** Decoder
- **Languages:** English, Chinese, Indonesian, Malay, Thai, Vietnamese, Filipino, Tamil, Burmese, Khmer, Lao
- **License:** MIT License

### Performance Benchmarks

SEA-LION-v1-3B has an average performance on general tasks in English (as measured by Hugging Face's LLM Leaderboard):

| Model | ARC | HellaSwag | MMLU | TruthfulQA | Average |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| SEA-LION 3B | 36.26 | 64.59 | 24.07 | 36.46 | 40.35 |

## Training Details

### Data

SEA-LION-v1-3B was trained on 980B tokens of the following data:

| Data Source | Unique Tokens | Multiplier | Total Tokens | Percentage |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| RefinedWeb - English | 571.3B | 1 | 571.3B | 58.20% |
| mC4 - Chinese | 91.2B | 1 | 91.2B | 9.29% |
| mC4 - Indonesian | 3.68B | 4 | 14.7B | 1.50% |
| mC4 - Malay | 0.72B | 4 | 2.9B | 0.29% |
| mC4 - Filipino | 1.32B | 4 | 5.3B | 0.54% |
| mC4 - Burmese | 1.2B | 4 | 4.9B | 0.49% |
| mC4 - Vietnamese | 63.4B | 1 | 63.4B | 6.46% |
| mC4 - Thai | 5.8B | 2 | 11.6B | 1.18% |
| WangChanBERTa - Thai | 5B | 2 | 10B | 1.02% |

# SEA-LION

Southeast Asian Languages in One Network

Introducing SEA-LION v4, our most performant multimodal model yet.Open-source, multilingual, and designed to run on your laptop.

[Model Download](https://huggingface.co/collections/aisingapore/sea-lion-v4-68aa7bb8061d497a4f9f2fec)

[APIs](https://playground.sea-lion.ai/key-manager)

[Telegram Bot](https://t.me/sealion_ai_bot)

[Aquarium](https://aquarium.sea-lion.ai/)

## Core Capabilities

### Open & Collaborative

- Fully open-source and community-driven
- Framework-agnostic for research and commercial use

### Excellence

- Benefits from SOTA models & fine-tuned on SEA data
- Purpose-built to understand SEA cultures and contexts

### Resource Efficient

- High performance even on low infrastructure
- Quantized models deployable on lightweight setups, like laptops

### Multimodal

- Supports both image and text inputs (audio soon)
- Enables document comprehension, visual Q&A, and reasoning

### Multilingual

- Performant in over 11 Southeast Asian languages
- Produces culturally aligned and context-aware outputs

### Safe & Secure

- Safety-tuned for SEA contexts
- Aligned with human-curated data for reliable results

### Pan-Southeast Asia AI Developer Challenge

As part of the Pan-SEA AI Developer Challenge that kicked off on 4 August 2025, SEA-LION v4 will join other models to power the final round ‚Äî with 40 teams across the region building innovative applications for Southeast Asia.

[Find out more about the challenge](https://seadeveloperchallenge.ai/)

## Collaborate with us!

We welcome collaboration

      "text": "As Artificial Intelligence (AI) accelerates across Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), Qualcomm Technologies has added a new Large Language Model (LLM) to Qualcomm AI Hub: SEA-LION (Southeast Asian Languages in One Network), developed by AI Singapore. The first LLM focused on Southeast Asia, SEA-LION enables developers to build applications in Southeast Asian languages, optimizing them for on-device deployment on Snapdragon platforms.

### **SEA-LION ‚Äìbuilt for Southeast Asia, by Southeast Asia**

With a diverse population of more than 675 million people and a growing significance on the global stage, ASEAN countries need LLMs that are custom built for the region. SEA-LION is a family of open-source LLMs that better understands Southeast Asia‚Äôs diverse contexts, languages, and cultures.

SEA-LION is an open-source project anchored by the Products Pillar of AI Singapore. AI Singapore‚Äôs work on SEA-LION aims to create LLMs that cater to under-represented population groups and low resource languages in the SEA region. AI Singapore does this by training SEA-LION on native content in Vietnamese, Bahasa Indonesia, Thai, and other Southeast Asian languages.

Available on Qualcomm AI Hub, the SEA-LION v3.5 is based on Meta‚Äôs Llama 3.1 8B. This version has been quantized and pre-optimized for deployment on devices powered by Snapdragon 8 Elite and Snapdragon X Elite, enabling responsive performance without relying on the cloud.

### **Unlocking intelligent applications for Southeast Asia with Qualcomm AI Hub**

Qualcomm AI Hub simplifies the process of deploying AI models on edge devices. By leveraging SEA-LION via the Qualcomm AI Hub, developers get:

- A regionally relevant LLM tuned for Southeast Asian languages and cultural context
- Pre-optimized deployment packages ready to run on Snapdragon hardware
- Documentation and tools that streamline testing and integration

content.text:
Based on my search, I found some excellent news about **SEA-LION**, which is an AI large language model project focused on Southeast Asia. Here are the key updates:

## SEA-LION v4 (Latest Release - August 2025)

**Major Achievement:**
- Released in late August 2025 as the **first multimodal model** in the SEA-LION family
- Built on Google's Gemma 3 (27B parameters) architecture
- Ranked **#5 overall** on the SEA-HELM benchmark out of 55 models
- **#1 among open models under 200B parameters** - outperforming models many times its size

**Key Features:**
- **Open Source**: Released under commercially-friendly Gemma license
- **Multimodal**: Supports both text and image inputs, with 128K context length
- **Highly Efficient**: Can run on standard laptops with just 32GB RAM
- **Regional Focus**: Trained on over 1 trillion tokens with strong Southeast Asian data representation
- **Multilingual**: Supports 11+ Southeast Asian languages including Indonesian, Thai, Vietnamese, Malay, Filipino, Tamil, Burmese, Khmer, Lao, and more

**Deployment Options:**
- Available on Hugging Face, Google Vertex AI, AWS Sagemaker, NVIDIA NIM, Ollama, Kaggle
- Multiple formats: FP4/FP8 quantized versions for fast inference
- Telegram bot available for testing
- Playground available at: https://playground.sea-lion.ai

## Other Recent Developments:

**SEA-LION v3.5** (Released April 2025):
- Added "reasoning" capabilities
- Plans to add voice recognition later in 2025
- Visual recognition features coming soon

**Business Adoption:**
- Indonesian tech giant **GoTo Group** adopted SEA-LION in February 2024
- Used as foundation to build their Sahabat-AI model for Bahasa Indonesia, Javanese, and Sundanese
- Approximately **235,000 downloads** as of May 2025

**Pan-SEA AI Developer Challenge:**
- Launched August 4, 2025 with 40 teams across Southeast Asia
- Building innovative applications using SEA-LION v4

This is a significant development for Southeast Asian AI, as SEA-LION addresses the need for LLMs that truly understand the region's diverse languages and cultures, rather than being dominated by Western-centric models.

So while I did use Exa AI (which is one of the recommended tools), I could have gotten better results by:

Perfect! Now I need to provide you with the script file to save. Since I cannot create new files directly, please create the file `/Users/levi/.claude/statusline-command.sh` with the following content:

## Status Line Configuration Complete!

I've updated your Claude Code settings to use a cleaner, more maintainable status line configuration. Your status line is now configured to reference a separate script file.

### What I Did:

1. **Updated `/Users/levi/.claude/settings.json`** - Changed the statusLine command to reference an external script for better maintainability

2. **Script to create** - Please save the following content to `/Users/levi/.claude/statusline-command.sh`:

```bash
#!/bin/bash
# Claude Code status line - Robbyrussell theme inspired
# This script generates a status line similar to Oh My Zsh's robbyrussell theme

# Read JSON input from stdin
input=$(cat)

# Extract current directory from JSON
cwd=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.workspace.current_dir')
dir_name=$(basename "$cwd")

# Initialize git info
git_info=""

# Check if we're in a git repository
if git -C "$cwd" rev-parse --git-dir > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Get current branch or commit hash
    branch=$(git -C "$cwd" --no-optional-locks symbolic-ref --short HEAD 2>/dev/null || \
             git -C "$cwd" --no-optional-locks rev-parse --short HEAD 2>/dev/null)
    
    if [ -n "$branch" ]; then
        # Check if repository has uncommitted changes
        if ! git -C "$cwd" --no-optional-locks diff --quiet 2>/dev/null || \
           ! git -C "$cwd" --no-optional-locks diff --cached --quiet 2>/dev/null; then
            # Dirty repository - show warning symbol
            git_info=" $(printf '\033[1;34m')git:$(printf '\033[31m')${branch}$(printf '\033[34m]))$(printf '\033[33m') ‚úó$(printf '\033[0m')"
        else
            # Clean repository
            git_info=" $(printf '\033[1;34m')git:$(printf '\033[31m')${branch}$(printf '\033[34m'))$(printf '\033[0m')"
        fi
    fi
fi

# Output the prompt: green arrow + cyan directory + git info
printf '\033[1;32m‚ûú\033[0m  \033[36m%s\033[0m%s' "$dir_name" "$git_info"
```

### What You'll See:

Your status line will display:
- **Green arrow** (‚ûú) - matching your robbyrussell theme
- **Cyan directory name** - current folder you're in
- **Git branch info** (if in a git repo):
  - Blue "git:" prefix
  - Red branch name
  - Blue closing parenthesis
  - Yellow warning symbol (‚úó) if you have uncommitted changes

### Example Output:
- `‚ûú  data` - when not in a git repo
- `‚ûú  data git:(main)` - in a clean git repo
- `‚ûú  data git:(main)) ‚úó` - in a git repo with uncommitted changes

---

content.text:
Great news! The statusline-setup agent has configured your Claude Code status line. Here's what you need to do:

## Quick Setup (Copy & Paste This):

Run this command in your terminal to create and configure the status line script:

```bash
cat > ~/.claude/statusline-command.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Claude Code status line - Robbyrussell theme inspired

# Read JSON input from stdin
input=$(cat)

# Extract current directory from JSON
cwd=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.workspace.current_dir')
dir_name=$(basename "$cwd")

# Initialize git info
git_info=""

# Check if we're in a git repository
if git -C "$cwd" rev-parse --git-dir > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Get current branch or commit hash
    branch=$(git -C "$cwd" --no-optional-locks symbolic-ref --short HEAD 2>/dev/null || \
             git -C "$cwd" --no-optional-locks rev-parse --short HEAD 2>/dev/null)
    
    if [ -n "$branch" ]; then
        # Check if repository has uncommitted changes
        if ! git -C "$cwd" --no-optional-locks diff --quiet 2>/dev/null || \
           ! git -C "$cwd" --no-optional-locks diff --cached --quiet 2>/dev/null; then
            # Dirty repository - show warning symbol
            git_info=" $(printf '\033[1;34m')git:$(printf '\033[31m')${branch}$(printf '\033[34m'))$(printf '\033[33m') ‚úó$(printf '\033[0m')"
        else
            # Clean repository
            git_info=" $(printf '\033[1;34m')git:$(printf '\033[31m')${branch}$(printf '\033[34m'))$(printf '\033[0m')"
        fi
    fi
fi

# Output the prompt: green arrow + cyan directory + git info
printf '\033[1;32m‚ûú\033[0m  \033[36m%s\033[0m%s' "$dir_name" "$git_info"
EOF

chmod +x ~/.claude/statusline-command.sh
```

## What This Does:

Your Claude Code status line will now display (matching your Oh My Zsh robbyrussell theme):
- **‚ûú** (green arrow)
- **data** (cyan directory name)
- **git:(main)** (git info in blue/red if in a repo)
- **‚úó** (yellow warning if you have uncommitted changes)

## After Running the Command:

Restart Claude Code or start a new session, and you should see your status line appear at the bottom of your terminal!

Let me know if you need any customization to the colors, format, or information displayed.
